ai_response:
Textual response:
Considering your back pain relief goal, I recommend the "Back Extension on Exercise Ball" (id: 1314). This exercise targets the spine and can help alleviate tension in the lower back. To perform this exercise, start by lying on an exercise ball with your stomach facing down. Engage your core muscles and slowly lift your arms, shoulders, and upper back off the ball, keeping your lower back pressed into the ball. Hold for a few seconds, then lower back down. Repeat for 10-15 repetitions.

This exercise can help improve your posture, reduce muscle imbalances, and strengthen your back muscles, which can help alleviate back pain.

Images: [1314]
